result.execSummary:
The defendant Gerhart RODRIGUEZ was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Gerhart RODRIGUEZ

records.addlTxt:
State files an Amended Information charging disorderly conduct, contrary to Section 947.01(1) of the Wisconsin Statutes.   
No contest plea to the amended charge.   Convicted.   $200.00 fine, plus costs, total of $705.00, to be paid by 03-11-16 or 14 days jail.   Defendant must submit DNA sample.   
Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights. 
Minutes.
Plea date is set for 01-11-16 at 9:00 a.m.

It is hereby ordered that Mr. Rodriguezis allowed to go into the front of the trailer park where Nicole McCollum resides for the purpose of exchanging their children at the front of the trailer park where she resides.
Copy to jail.

No agreement.
Pretrial conference is set for 01-04-16 at 9:30 a.m.
Jury trial is set for 01-12-16 at 8:30 a.m. no: 1 position.
Minutes.

Settlement Conference Summary.
Settlement conference with District Attorney is reset to 10-14-15 at 9:00 a.m.
Defendant's Notice of Motion; Defendant's Demand and Motion for Discovery and Inspection.
State's Motion and Demand for Discovery.
Charging one count of 2nd degree recklessly endangering safety, contrary to Section 941.30(2).

Defendant waives his right to a preliminary hearing.  Defendant is bound over to Circuit Court Branch 3 for trial.
ARRAIGNMENT - 
Information filed. Copy served on defense counsel.
Not guilty plea entered.  Jury calendar.
Settlement conference with District Attorney is set for 08-05-15 at 10:00 a.m.
Plea date is set for 09-24-15 at 2:30 p.m.
Waiver of Right to Preliminary Hearing.
Minutes.

Defendant demands a preliminary hearing and waives the statutory time period within which a preliminary hearing must be held.   Preliminary hearing is set for 07-02-15 at 1:30 p.m.     
Minutes.

Defendant in custody.  The State informs the Court that the defendant will be charged with the crime of 2nd degree recklessly endangering safety.  The matter is  continued for initial appearance on 06-15-15 at 2:30 p.m.  Bail is set at $2,000.00 recognizance bond with the conditions that he have no contact with Efren Gonzalez or any premises he occupies, no contact with Nikkole McCollum, but 3rd part contact will be allowed with Nikkole for purposes of child visitation arrangements.   Bail furnished and defendant is released from custody.
Minutes.
